title: Reason why tanks are so strong right now
body:
1. mages sucks in the meta right now(mostly because of items), tanks usually just build a spirit visage as their only magic resist item and mages cant do any meaningful dmg to the tank. this means tanks can opt more into armor which defenses them against ad assasins and adc who are stronger in the meta right now.

2. all the changes making game time shorter means adc(the only counter to tanks) will less likely to reach their 5~6item scaling and will need to buy LW very early(3~4th item), meaning less dmg threat for tanks.

3. grasp of undying broken mastery+ all of the juggernaut item protentially giving tanks enough dmg to threat the backline

4. carry jungler + azir/corki/zed/lb mid means less cc to peel.

5. mid~short ranged carries in the meta meaning less safety and easy to get rekt by tanks

anything else?

Ok, just because an item has a stat/passive doesn't mean that it's "free". It's what you are paying for when you spend gold on the item. Nobody would buy the item if it just had +65 AD + 20% Crit and nothing else.

You're right that ER could certainly stand to be toned down a peg. Maybe in the CdR department, lowering the value from 30% max to 20% max?

Or you just get both and have both.

I have to agree, so many people saying its a tank meta because some people have problems with tanks but the real problem recently has been bruisers and dmg dealers building tanky items and still doing ridiculous amounts of dmg. Basically it was what i would call a dmg meta, where you can build a few dmg items (sometimes only 2 on certain champions) and a bunch of tank items and still do really good dmg, ekko and the adcs a while back attest to this.
Its why things like tank fizz and split push heimer are so damn annoying, its why graves is so strong. However with all this dmg floating around it does mean tanks do more even when building full tank (was in part thanks to the now nerfed grasp of the undying)

The thing is with all these dmg dealers and bruisers building tanky, they can bully some other bruisers and squishy champions but against true tanks they can't do much, especially since a lot of the heavy tanks have either high base numbers or hp damage (along with grasp).

Also as the OP said, with how much dmg is floating around the adcs have a harder time of getting to their dmg spikes and actually dealing dmg to the tanks and with so many people playing lower cc champions there is very little to stop tanks once they get going.

Tanks naturally counter AP Burst damage. Mages never were the choice to take down tanks.

They never bought more than one MR item unless the team was heavily AP. Tanks build armor because they are weak to DPS which typically comes from ADCs.

AP Burst mages are supposed to take out the ones doing the DPS. It works like a little triangle of damage, or at least it's supposed to.

Tanks are just too good at everything right now. They absorb so much damage, can dive without any issues, and they do so much damage. There aren't that many trade offs for picking a tank, and that's why everyone wants them in their games.

I believe it is a combination of their items/stats being so good and towers being so weak. Armor penetration isn't as common or great as it once was either.

Tank power was necessary when the ADC meta was alive and assaulting us all for a brief period earlier this year, but now there are only a few hanging on. {{champion:202}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:96}} 

None of them are really worth banning. "Tank" Fizz and "Tank" Ekko are specific problems that have to do with assassins and the old question of how much reliability can you give an assassin before they start to abuse it. 

The answer is still none.

Actually I think it is because of how many health+dmg items there are that is making tanks harder to deal with.

There are a lot of items that combine high health/armor with dmg stats that scale incredibly well.

Of course a lot of that is due to more people using tanks that are primarily fighters with tank scaling like Garen, Darius, Fiora, Trundle etc. And with how well they scale in general in addition to those items they use, there is a reason why they snowball incredibly fast.

This is a very accurate summary. Also with how fragile towers are, it's very easy for tanks to dive at the moment without feeling any real impact.
Long death timers also naturally favor tanks, as they will be dead the least amount of time in a game statistically.
